セブン８店、時短営業を開始…最長休業は午後１１時から午前７時

01 Nov 2019, 14:04

　セブン―イレブン・ジャパンは１日、全国の加盟店８店で、深夜に休業する時短営業を始めた。チェーン本部は「２４時間営業が原則」との方針を変えていないが、深刻な人手不足から時短営業を検討する店舗は多い。今後、時短営業がさらに広がるか、注目される。
　セブンは４月以降、約２万１０００の加盟店のうち、時短を希望する約２３０店で順次、実証実験を進めている。このうち、半年間の実験期間の終了後、深夜休業を希望した８店が今回、完全に時短営業へ移行した。８店の所在地など詳細は発表されていないが、最長の休業時間は、午後１１時から午前７時までの８時間だという。
　今後も、実験を終えた店舗が、時短営業に完全移行するケースは増えるとみられる。
　現在、実験に参加中の東日本の加盟店オーナーは「深夜の売り上げはなくなったが、人件費を抑えることができ、利益は減っていない」と話す。半年間の実験期間を終えた後、時短営業への完全移行に向け、本部と協議する予定だという。

Seven Seven stores, opening short hours ... The longest holiday is from 11pm to 7am

01 Nov 2019, 14:04

Seven-Eleven Japan started a short-time operation at eight franchisees nationwide on Sunday, closed at midnight. The chain headquarters has not changed the policy of "24 hours a day in principle", but many stores are considering short-term business due to serious labor shortage. In the future, it will be noticed whether the short-time business will further expand.
[7] Since April, out of approximately 21,000 member stores, Seven has been conducting demonstration experiments sequentially at approximately 230 stores that want a shorter time. Of these, 8 stores that wished to close late at night after the end of the half-year experiment period have now shifted to full-time operations. Details of the location of the eight stores have not been announced, but the longest closed time is 8 hours from 11 pm to 7 am.
In the future, it is expected that the number of stores that have completed the experiment will completely shift to short-term sales.
“A franchise owner in East Japan who is currently participating in the experiment says,“ Sales at midnight have disappeared, but labor costs have been reduced and profits have not decreased. ” After the half-year experiment period, the company plans to discuss with the headquarters for a complete transition to short-term sales.
